metadata.titel_preek: On the Wrong Side of the Ditch . . . for a Long Time

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The story of the Rich Man and Lazarus as a cosmic reversal where earthly indifference leads to eternal separation.

subject.identificatie: The Rich Man (and by extension, the Hearer/Brothers)
tekstueel_bewijs: He is the one who will claim our major attention.
He is, as he is expected to be, the main character.
You of course did not know it, but even then you were settling your long-term choice.
the hidden stuff after death is the more crucial and risky matter

zender.identificatie: Moses/The Law (as the source of values and warning)
tekstueel_bewijs: The messenger has already been sent... Moses, hard, tough, unaccommodating Moses.
The word is that we have already been warned.
we are closest to the role of the brothers
it is not too late for them

helper.identificatie: The Story/The Warning (Lazarus is refused as a helper)
tekstueel_bewijs: The story does not ask anyone to do anything... it is enough to see.
Lazarus will not go on your errand.
helper.rol_van_god: Absent (God is the 'rearranger' but not an active helper to the Subject)

tekstueel_bewijs: your indifference to neighbor matters to eternity
the same kind of abyss that used to exist between your wealth and his need
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The 'ditch' is an ontological reality that becomes fixed in eternity, representing a total loss of identity and life.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical requirement to love the neighbor to avoid the ditch.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon claims it is 'not advice,' yet the entire narrative weight rests on the hearer's 'indifference' being the cause of the eternal ditch.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: The Hearer → Eternal Comfort (via avoiding indifference)

voorbeelden_god_subject: God... takes them out of our control
voorbeelden_mens_subject: You were settling your long-term choice
We baptized have agreed to host the haunting

voorbeelden: He no longer thinks of himself, but only of his brothers
who would think that the truth of Moses is enough
If only they can find out
The word is that we have already been warned
I only acted as I did because I did not know any better
I cannot reach across to you

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon operates on the assumption that 'Knowing' (Savoir) the warning of Moses is the only thing standing between the hearer and the ditch. It lacks a 'Pouvoir' (Power) provided by Grace.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from the 'Indifference' of life (~S1) to the 'Judgment' of Hades (S2), then attempts to move the hearer to 'The Warning' (~S2) as a way to avoid S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Unresolved. The sermon ends with 'haunting' rather than a path to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; S2 is presented as an irreversible cosmic reality.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: Despite the rhetorical disclaimer that it is 'not advice,' the actantial structure is purely anthropocentric. The hearer is the Subject who must heed a warning to avoid a self-created fate. God is a passive judge/rearranger, not a Savior.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: If you obey, you may come on in... If you don’t obey, duck.
You of course did not know it, but even then you were settling your long-term choice.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: no questions asked, no conditions, no qualifications to meet

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The Rich Man serves as a negative exemplar (the 'unnamed' role) while the brothers/hearers are the potential subjects who must learn from his failure.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: A theocentric reading would focus on God as the seeker of the lost, or Christ as the one who crossed the ditch that we could not.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Anxiety and 'haunting'; a sense of being 'warned' but not 'empowered'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Salvation is contingent upon the hearer's response to the Law (Moses).

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: There is a clash between the description of Abraham's 'no conditions' grace and the sermon's ultimate insistence on the 'tough Moses' as the only available messenger.
spanning_punten: The claim that the story is 'not advice' vs. the intense focus on 'our indifference matters to eternity'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The story... reframe[s] our economic life... our indifference to neighbor matters to eternity.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: None. The hearer is left with the 'haunting' of the Law.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High (leads to eternal ditch), but treated as a failure of 'noticing' rather than a corruption of nature.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'Law-event.' The Subject is the Hearer, the Object is avoiding Judgment, and the Sender is Moses. God is relegated to a background role of enforcing the 'ditch' that humans dig.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the primary actor responsible for bridging or creating the ditch.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Christ the Subject who crosses the ditch that the Rich Man (and we) created.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'You were settling your choice,' use 'Christ has crossed the abyss that our indifference created, seeking us even on the wrong side of the ditch.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Identifying with the 'warned' brothers who must perform better than the Rich Man.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Position the hearer as Lazarus—one who is 'dirty and with sores' but is carried by angels, not by his own 'noticing'.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Proclaim how the Spirit grants the 'Pouvoir' to love the neighbor, which the Law (Moses) only demands but cannot give.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The 'Ditch' is already presented as a cosmic, irreversible opponent.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The Law is already doing its work; the Gospel is what is missing.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The Secondary Program (Ethics) has swallowed the Primary Program (Soteriology).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: 1. God saves the poor/lost (Soteriology). 2. Therefore, we are freed from the idolatry of wealth (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically brilliant and 'haunting,' but it leaves the hearer under the weight of Moses without the rescue of Christ. It diagnoses the ditch perfectly but fails to provide the bridge-builder.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would praise the 'haunting' imagery; Greimas reveals this haunting is the weight of an unfulfilled Devoir-faire.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the Lukan context of wealth; Greimas shows the preacher has functionally replaced God with Moses as the Sender.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes that the 'Rich Man' and the 'Hearer' are actantially identical, making the sermon a recruitment for better moral performance rather than a proclamation of divine action.

appendices.notities: The sermon explicitly rejects being 'advice' while structurally functioning as a severe warning, creating a modal tension between Devoir (Must) and Savoir (Know).
